error.signature:
WARNING: DATA RACE
Read at 0x00c0000 by goroutine N:
Previous write at 0x00c0000 by goroutine M:
error.regex: WARNING: DATA RACE.*Read at.*by goroutine.*Previous write at.*by goroutine

verdict.summary: Go 1.22+ race detector found unsynchronized read/write access to shared memory from different goroutines. The improved race detector in 1.22 catches more races with lower overhead.

dead_ends.action: Disable the race detector with build tags to suppress warnings
dead_ends.why_fails: The race still exists in production â€” disabling detection does not fix the bug, it just hides it

dead_ends.action: Use atomic operations on complex structs
dead_ends.why_fails: atomic only works for primitive types (int32, int64, pointer); struct-level atomics are not supported
dead_ends.condition: when the shared data is a struct or slice

workarounds.action: Protect shared state with sync.Mutex or sync.RWMutex
workarounds.how:
var mu sync.RWMutex
mu.RLock() // for reads
mu.Lock()  // for writes

workarounds.action: Use sync/atomic for simple counters and flags
workarounds.how:
var counter atomic.Int64
counter.Add(1)
val := counter.Load()
workarounds.condition: when shared data is a single primitive value

leads_to.condition: when race causes nil to be read before initialization

preceded_by.condition: when goroutine leak patterns involve shared state

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'DATA RACE' is about unsynchronized memory access across goroutines, while 'deadlock' is about goroutines permanently blocked waiting on channels.
